title: Family of teen killed in motorbike crash to sue Trump administration
text:
Harry Dunn’s family have accused the Trump administration of twisting the laws on diplomatic immunity

Harry Dunn’s family are suing the Trump administration after it granted diplomatic immunity to the woman involved in the crash that killed the teenager.

Nineteen-year-old Harry died after being knocked off his motorbike near RAF Croughton, a US spy base in Northamptonshire, on August 27.

Driver Anne Sacoolas is believed to have been driving on the wrong side of the road and returned to America shortly after the incident.

She was granted immunity from prosecution because her husband is a US diplomat.

Harry’s family have been fighting a high-profile campaign to get Mrs Sacoolas to return to the UK to answer questions, and met President Donald Trump at the White House earlier this month .

Charlotte Charles and Tim Dunn are suing the Trump administration in memory of their son (Picture: Rex Features)

Mrs Sacoolas was in the building at the time but they turned down an unexpected last-minute offer to meet her.

Spokesman for the Dunns, Radd Seiger, said it was a ‘disgusting stunt’ to try to get the family in the same room as Mrs Sacoolas.

He announced plans to sue the Trump administration for lawless misconduct and a cover up after the President failed to follow through with promises to support the family.

Mr Seiger said in a statement: ‘We are bringing claims against both Mrs Sacoolas in the USA for civil damages as well as the Trump administration for their lawless misconduct and attempt to cover that up.

‘No one is above the law and the family are determined to ensure that this never happens to another family again.

‘It will be Harry’s memorial. His legacy.’

Mr Seiger accused the US government of twisting the laws’ on diplomat immunity.

He added: ‘The Trump administration is not only hell bent on breaking international laws, rules and conventions on diplomatic immunity, but they have no care or concern for the welfare of Harry’s family or any real intent on finding a solution.

Harry Dunn died when his motorbike crashed into a car outside RAF Croughton in Northamptonshire (Picture: PA)

‘President Trump told mum Charlotte at the meeting that we would look to approach the problem from a different angle, but the family have heard no further and have no faith in his words.’

The family have already started a case against the UK Foreign Office over the decision to grant Mrs Sacoolas immunity.

British police confirmed last week that they would interview Mrs Sacoolas under caution in the US after she requested to be interviewed there by Northamptonshire Police.

They say she had ‘cooperated fully’ and had spoken to them at the scene after the crash and the next day at her home.

Mrs Sacoolas previously said through her lawyer that she was ‘devastated by this tragic accident’ but Harry’s mother, Charlotte Charles, rejected the apology, saying ‘sorry doesn’t cut it’.

description: Family of Harry Dun, the teen killed in motorbike crash to sue Trump administration
